laboratory_examinations.findings: Slit-lamp examination showed severe blepharitis with mucopurulent discharge, epiphoria, and absent Meibomian glands in both eyes. Cycloplegic objective refraction was +6.25/-2×180° in the right eye and +6.75/-2×10 in the left eye, with best-corrected visual acuity of 20/200 in both eyes. Schirmer test with anesthetics was normal. Mean fluorescein tear-film break-up time was 4 seconds in the right eye and 5 seconds in the left eye, indicating rapid tear evaporation. Anterior segment examination showed bilateral superficial punctuate keratitis. Fundoscopy was unremarkable in both eyes.
Bilateral severely reduced cone responses consistent with a diagnosis of congenital cone dystrophy.
Normal, suggesting an early stage of the disease.
Revealed two pathogenic variants: c.931A > G (p.Ser311Gly) in the TP63 gene (de novo) and c.1810C > T (p.Arg604Ter) in the CNGB3 gene (homozygous from heterozygous parents).
